meanings.definition: A very small amount or quantity
meanings.sent1: She added a few smidgens of sugar to her tea.
meanings.sent2: He sprinkled smidgens of salt on the popcorn.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled smidgens of pepper, creating a spicy cloud.
meanings.sent4: The stars twinkled like smidgens of light in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The detective found smidgens of evidence that led to the culprit.

meanings.sent1: There were smidgens of chocolate left in the box.
meanings.sent2: She noticed tiny smidgens of paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with smidgens of yarn, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like smidgens of a puzzle, waiting to be put together.
meanings.sent5: The old book was filled with smidgens of wisdom on every page.
